title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others‚Äô private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement andrew.bruce@northstarrevenueintegrity.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Adjustment Codes
text: Group Codes Claim Adjustment Reason Codes (CARCs) serve distinct complementary purposes medical billing remittance advice:

title: Adjustment Codes
text: Group Codes identify general category high-level reason payment adjustment. provide overarching classification type adjustment made.[5] main Group Codes : CO (Contractual Obligation): Adjustment due contractual agreement regulatory requirement, typically write-provider.[3][5] OA (Adjustment): Used group code applies adjustment.[3][5] PR (Patient Responsibility): Adjustment representing amount billed patient, deductibles copays.[3][5] PI (Payer Initiated Reductions): Adjustment initiated payer believe provider financially liable, supporting contract.[3] Group Code must always used conjunction Claim Adjustment Reason Code provide specific reason adjustment.[5]

title: Adjustment Codes
text: CARCs granular, three-character alphanumeric codes describe precise reason claim service line paid differently billed.[1][4] provide detailed explanations adjustments, : CO16: Claim lacks information needed adjudication.[1] PR1: Deductible amount.[1] OA23: Charges unbundled.[1] Group Codes categorize general type adjustment, CARCs give exact rationale behind specific payment adjustment made claim line claim.[2][4] combination Group Code CARC fully communicates nature responsibility differences billed paid amounts. Citations: [1] https://x12.org/codes/claim-adjustment-reason-codes [2] https://www.aapc.com/support/common-terms/claim-adjustment-reason-codes [3] https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/claim-adjustments-group-code-reason-values-co-cr-oa-jvs-prasad [4] https://docs.claim.md/docs/claim-adjustment-reason-codes [5] https://www.cms.gov/regulations--guidance/guidance/manuals/downloads/clm104c22pdf.pdf

title: Adjustment Codes
text: purpose Remittance Advice Remark Codes (RARCs) provide additional explanation adjustment already described Claim Adjustment Reason Code (CARC) convey information remittance processing.[1][2] Specifically, RARCs serve two main functions: Supplemental RARCs provide additional details clarification adjustment already described CARC. example, CARC may indicate claim denied due missing information, supplemental RARC specify exact information missing.[1] Informational RARCs, prefaced ‚ÄúAlert:‚Äù, convey information remittance processing , rather related specific adjustment CARC. alerts communicate things like changes procedure codes, potential impacts patient liability, processing details.[1] summary, CARCs explain reason adjustment claim payment, RARCs give additional context, details, processing information related adjustments remittance advice whole.[2] combination CARCs RARCs allows clear communication payers providers regarding claim adjudication decisions. Citations: [1] https://x12.org/codes/remittance-advice-remark-codes [2] https://med.noridianmedicare.com/web/jeb/topics/ra [3] https://www.palmettogba.com/palmetto/jmb.nsf//2NF7NSFT1B [4] https://files.ontario.ca/moh_1/moh-remittance-advice-explanatory-codes-2022-12-en-2023-05-15.pdf [5] https://www.novitas-solutions.com/webcenter/portal/MedicareJH/pagebyid?contentId=00243417

title: Fee Schedule Calculations
text: Physician Fee Schedule Variables  Physician Fee Schedule Formulas  corresponding GPCI value three components RVU, formula essentially dot product RVU GPCI vectors, multiplied Conversion Factor:  \[ RVU \cdot GPCI = RVU_w(GPCI_w) + RVU_p(GPCI_p) + RVU_m(GPCI_m) \]   Using base r‚Äôs matrix multiplication infix operator  Using dot() function {pracma} package
code: wrvu  = 6.26   # Work RVU wgpci = 1      # Work GPCI  pgpci = 0.883  # Practice GPCI prvu  = 4.36   # Practice RVU  mrvu  = 0.99   # Malpractice RVU mgpci = 1.125  # Malpractice GPCI  cf    = 32.744 # Conversion Factor  rvus <- (wrvu * wgpci) + (prvu * pgpci) + (mrvu * mgpci) rvus # Total RVUs #> [1] 11.22363 rvus * cf # Participating Fee #> [1] 367.5065 as.vector(c(wrvu, prvu, mrvu) %*% c(wgpci, pgpci, mgpci)) #> [1] 11.22363 pracma::dot(   c(wrvu, prvu, mrvu),    c(wgpci, pgpci, mgpci)) #> [1] 11.22363 calculate_amounts(   wrvu  = 6.26,   nprvu = 7.92,   fprvu = 4.36,   mrvu  = 0.99,   cf    = 32.744,   wgpci = 1,   pgpci = 0.883,   mgpci = 1.125) |>    tt() |>    format_tt(markdown = TRUE) |>    style_tt(bootstrap_class = "table table-hover")

title: Columns
text: file contains information services covered Medicare Physician Fee Schedule (MPFS) 2024. 10,000 physician services, file contains associated relative value units (RVUs), fee schedule status indicator, various payment policy indicators needed payment adjustment (.e., payment assistant surgery, team surgery, bilateral surgery, etc.). Medicare physician fee schedule amounts adjusted reflect variation practice costs area area. geographic practice cost index (GPCI) established every Medicare payment locality three components procedure‚Äôs relative value unit (.e., RVUs work, practice expense, malpractice). GPCIs applied calculation fee schedule payment amount multiplying RVU component times GPCI component. hcpcs HCPCS Code HCPCS Code description Description HCPCS Procedure Description mod Modifier Diagnostic Tests, NA denotes Global Service, Mods 26 & TC identify Components. Mod 53 indicates Separate RVUs & PFS Amount Procedures Terminated Completion. status Status Code Indicates Fee Schedule, Covered, Separately Payable. , R T used Medicare payment. wrvu Work RVU RVUs Physician Work nprvu Non-Facility Practice Expense RVU RVUs Non-Facility Practice Expense fprvu Facility Practice Expense RVU RVUs Facility Practice Expense mrvu Malpractice RVU RVUs Malpractice Expense cf Conversion Factor Multiplier Transforms RVUs Payment Amounts nprvu_opps Non-Facility PE Used OPPS Payment Amount Non-Facility Practice Expense RVUs OPPS Payment fprvu_opps Facility PE Used OPPS Payment Amount Facility Practice Expense RVUs OPPS Payment global Global Days Number Global Days op_ind Operative Percentage Indicator 1 = percentages, 0 = percentages op_pre Preoperative Percentage Preoperative % Global Package op_intra Intraoperative Percentage Intraoperative % Global Package, including Postoperative Work Hospital op_post Postoperative Percentage Postoperative % Global Package, Provided Office, Post-Discharge pctc PCTC Indicator PCTC Payment Adjustment mult_proc Multiple Procedure Indicator Multiple Procedures (Mod 51) Payment Adjustment surg_bilat Bilateral Surgery Indicator Bilateral Procedure (Mod 50) Payment Adjustment surg_asst Assistant Surgery Indicator Assistant Surgery (Mods 80, 81, 82, ) Payment Adjustment surg_co Co-Surgery Indicator Co-surgeons (Mod 62) Payment Adjustment surg_team Team Surgery Indicator Team Surgeons (Mod 66) Payment Adjustment endo Endoscopic Base Code Endoscopic Base Code HCPCS Multiple Surgery indicator 3 supvis Physician Supervision Indicator Physician Supervision Level Required Service dximg Diagnostic Imaging Family Indicator Diagnostic Service Family HCPCS Multiple Procedure indicator 4 unused Used Medicare Payment Whether Code used Medicare Payment rare Rarely/Never Performed Procedure rarely/never performed : 00 (Neither), 01 (Facility), 10 (Non-Facility), 11 ()

title: Search Restructured BETOS Classifications ‚Äî search_rbcs
text: Restructured BETOS Classification System (RBCS) taxonomy allows researchers group Medicare Part B healthcare service codes clinically meaningful categories subcategories. Based original Berenson-Eggers Type Service (BETOS) classification created 1980s, includes notable updates Part B non-physician services undergoes annual updates technical expert panel researchers clinicians. general framework grouping service codes new RBCS taxonomy largely follows structure BETOS. Like BETOS, RBCS groups HCPCS codes categories, subcategories, families ‚Äì categories aggregate level families granular level. Medicare Part B service codes, including non-physician services, assigned 6-character RBCS taxonomy code.

code: switch_bilateral_surgery(c(0:3, "9")) #> [1] "Adjustment does not apply. If reported with mod 50 or RT and LT, payment for the two sides is the lower of (a) total charge for both sides (b) 100% of fee schedule amount for a single code. Adjustment is inappropriate because (a) of physiology or anatomy, or (b) code description states it is a unilateral procedure and there is an existing code for the bilateral procedure."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                #> [2] "Adjustment applies. If reported with bilateral modifier or twice on same day by any other means (with RT and LT mods, or with a 2 in the units field), base payment on lower of: (a) total charge for both sides or (b) 150% of fee schedule amount for a single code. If reported as bilateral procedure and reported with other procedure codes on same day, apply bilateral adjustment before applying any multiple procedure rules."                                                                                                                                                                               #> [3] "Adjustment does not apply. RVUs already based on procedure as a bilateral procedure. If reported with mod -50 or twice on same day by any other means, base payment on lower of (a) total charge for both sides, or (b) 100% of fee schedule for a single code."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       #> [4] "Adjustment does not apply. If reported with mod 50 or for both sides on same day by any other means, base payment for each side or organ or site of paired organ on lower of (a) charge for each side or (b) 100% of fee schedule amount for each side. If reported as bilateral procedure and with other procedure codes on same day, determine fee schedule amount for a bilateral procedure before applying any multiple procedure rules. Services in this category are generally radiology procedures or other diagnostic tests which are not subject to the special payment rules for other bilateral surgeries." #> [5] "Concept does not apply"

title: Multiple Procedure Descriptions ‚Äî switch_multiple_procedure
code: switch_multiple_procedure(as.character(0:9)) #>  [1] "No adjustment. If procedure is reported on the same day as another procedure, base the payment on the lower of (a) the actual charge, or (b) the fee schedule amount for the procedure."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            #>  [2] "Standard adjustment. If reported on the same day as another procedure with an indicator of 1, 2, or 3, rank the procedures by fee schedule amount and apply the appropriate reduction to this code (100%, 50%, 25%, 25%, 25%, and by report). Base payment on the lower of (a) the actual charge, or (b) the fee schedule amount reduced by the appropriate percentage."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            #>  [3] "Standard adjustment. If reported on the same day as another procedure with an indicator of 1, 2, or 3, rank the procedures by fee schedule amount and apply the appropriate reduction to this code (100%, 50%, 50%, 50%, 50% and by report). Base payment on the lower of (a) the actual charge, or (b) the fee schedule amount reduced by the appropriate percentage."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             #>  [4] "Special rules for multiple endoscopic procedures apply if procedure is billed with another endoscopy in the same family (i.e., another endoscopy that has the same base procedure). The base procedure for each code with this indicator is identified in the Endobase column. Apply the multiple endoscopy rules to a family before ranking the family with the other procedures performed on the same day (for example, if multiple endoscopies in the same family are reported on the same day as endoscopies in another family or on the same day as a non-endoscopic procedure). If an endoscopic procedure is reported with only its base procedure, do not pay separately for the base procedure. Payment for the base procedure is included in the payment for the other endoscopy."                                                                                                                                                                                                        #>  [5] "Special rules for the technical component (TC) of diagnostic imaging procedures apply if procedure is billed with another diagnostic imaging procedure in the same family (per the diagnostic imaging family indicator, below). If procedure is reported in the same session on the same day as another procedure with the same family indicator, rank the procedures by fee schedule amount for the TC. Pay 100% for the highest priced procedure, and 50% for each subsequent procedure. Base the payment for subsequent procedures on the lower of (a) the actual charge, or (b) the fee schedule amount reduced by the appropriate percentage. Subject to 50% reduction of the TC diagnostic imaging (effective for services July 1, 2010 and after). Subject to 25% reduction of the PC of diagnostic imaging (effective for services January 1, 2012 through December 31, 2016). Subject to 5% reduction of the PC of diagnostic imaging (effective for services January 1, 2017 and after)." #>  [6] "Subject to 50% of the practice expense component for certain therapy services." services, effective for services January 1, 2013, and thereafter." January 1, 2013, and thereafter."
